text: Apoxyptilus anthites is a species of moth in the family Pterophoridae. It is known to originate from Kenya, South Africa, Tanzania and Uganda. The wingspan is 9–11 mm. The larvae feed on the buds of Dombeya emarginata. ==Etymology== The generic name indicates that this genus not closely related to Oxyptilus. ==References== Category:Oxyptilini Category:Moths of Africa Category:Moths described in 1936
title: Apoxyptilus anthites
